extends java.lang.Object

        Overrides:

      • getPlyr

        public int getPlyr(int x,
                   int y)
        This method takes the coordinates of a spot on the board and returns the player at that piece.
        Parameters:
        x - - the x coordinate of the pieces
        y - - the y coordinate of the piece
        Returns:
        0, if an empty spot, 1 for player 1 or 2 for player 2

      • setPlyr

        public void setPlyr(int x,
                    int y,
                    int player)
        This takes the coordinates of a spot on the board and sets the piece at that place to the player that is passed into the method.
        Parameters:
        x - - the x coordinate of the spot
        y - - the y coordinate of the spot
        player - - the value of the player (1 or 2 if a player, 0 if empty)

      • nextPlyr

        public void nextPlyr()
        This method toggles the current player, between other player and current player.

      • getCurrPlyr

        public int getCurrPlyr()
        This function returns the current player.
        Returns:
        current player in game

      • isValidMove

        public boolean isValidMove(int x,
                           int y)
        Parameters:
        x - - the x position of the move
        y - - the y position of the move
        Returns:
        true if move is valid, else false

      • checkDirections

        public boolean checkDirections(int x,
                               int y,
                               int xChange,
                               int yChange)
        This function is used to check to see if there are any pieces to capture in one of the eight selected directions. (direction is set by xChange & yChange)
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -
        xChange -
        yChange -
        Returns:
        true if the selection direction can capture pieces, else false

      • playPiece

        public void playPiece(int initX,
                      int initY)
        This method plays the pieces and flips all of the opponent's captured pieces.
        Parameters:
        initX - - x value of the piece that was played
        initY - - y value of the piece that was played

      • getWinner

        public int getWinner()
        This method returns the winner based on the count of black verses white pieces on the board as you navigate the board.
        Returns:
        1 if player One wins, 2 if Player 2 wins, -1 if tie

      • newGame

        public void newGame()
        This method creates a new game with current player set to player 1(black).

      • whiteScore

        public int whiteScore()
        This method counts the number of pieces white has on the board.
        Returns:
        returns white's score

      • blackScore

        public int blackScore()
        This method counts the number of pieces black has on the board.
        Returns:
        returns black's score

      • canMove

        public boolean canMove()
        This method determines if the current player can move.
        Returns:
        true if the current player can move, false otherwise
